trans-unit.source: Register for Microsoft authentication | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Register for Microsoft authentication | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to register for Microsoft authentication in your Azure Mobile Services application.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to register for Microsoft authentication in your Azure Mobile Services application.

trans-unit.source: Register your app to use Microsoft account for authentication
trans-unit.target: Register your app to use Microsoft account for authentication

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to register your mobile app to be able to use Microsoft account as an identity provider with Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to register your mobile app to be able to use Microsoft account as an identity provider with Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: The same steps apply for both service-directed authentication and client-directed authentication using the Live SDK.
trans-unit.target: The same steps apply for both service-directed authentication and client-directed authentication using the Live SDK.

trans-unit.source: Register your Windows Store app at the Windows Dev Center
trans-unit.target: Register your Windows Store app at the Windows Dev Center

trans-unit.source: Windows Store apps must first be registered with the Windows Dev Center.
trans-unit.target: Windows Store apps must first be registered with the Windows Dev Center.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]Windows Phone 8, Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight, and non-Windows apps can skip this section.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]Windows Phone 8, Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight, and non-Windows apps can skip this section.

trans-unit.source: If you have not already registered your app, navigate to the [Submit an app page] at the Dev Center for Windows Store apps, log on with your Microsoft account, and then click **App name**.
trans-unit.target: If you have not already registered your app, navigate to the [Submit an app page] at the Dev Center for Windows Store apps, log on with your Microsoft account, and then click **App name**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Create a new app by reserving a unique name** and click **Continue**, then type a name for your app in **App name**, click **Reserve app name** and then **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Create a new app by reserving a unique name** and click **Continue**, then type a name for your app in **App name**, click **Reserve app name** and then **Save**.

trans-unit.source: This creates a new Windows Store registration for your app.
trans-unit.target: This creates a new Windows Store registration for your app.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open the project that you created when you completed the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services](mobile-services-dotnet-backend-windows-store-dotnet-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open the project that you created when you completed the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services](mobile-services-dotnet-backend-windows-store-dotnet-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: In solution explorer, right-click the Windows Store app project, click **Store**, and then click **Associate App with the Store...**.
trans-unit.target: In solution explorer, right-click the Windows Store app project, click **Store**, and then click **Associate App with the Store...**.

trans-unit.source: This displays the **Associate Your App with the Windows Store** Wizard.
trans-unit.target: This displays the **Associate Your App with the Windows Store** Wizard.

trans-unit.source: In the wizard, click **Sign in** and then login with your Microsoft account, select the app name that you reserved in step 2, then click **Next** > **Associate**.
trans-unit.target: In the wizard, click **Sign in** and then login with your Microsoft account, select the app name that you reserved in step 2, then click **Next** > **Associate**.

trans-unit.source: This adds the required Windows Store registration information to the application manifest.
trans-unit.target: This adds the required Windows Store registration information to the application manifest.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) For a universal Windows app, repeat steps 4 and 5 for the Windows Phone Store project.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) For a universal Windows app, repeat steps 4 and 5 for the Windows Phone Store project.

trans-unit.source: Back in the Windows Dev Center page for your new app, click **Services** > **Push notifications**.
trans-unit.target: Back in the Windows Dev Center page for your new app, click **Services** > **Push notifications**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Push notifications** page, click **Live Services site** under **Windows Push Notification Services (WNS) and Microsoft Azure Mobile Services**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Push notifications** page, click **Live Services site** under **Windows Push Notification Services (WNS) and Microsoft Azure Mobile Services**.

trans-unit.source: This displays the Microsoft account page for your app.
trans-unit.target: This displays the Microsoft account page for your app.

trans-unit.source: Configure your Microsoft account registration and connect to Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Configure your Microsoft account registration and connect to Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: The first step in this section applies only to Windows Phone 8, Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight, and non-Windows Store apps.
trans-unit.target: The first step in this section applies only to Windows Phone 8, Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight, and non-Windows Store apps.

trans-unit.source: For these apps, you can also ignore the Package security identifier (SID), which is only available for Windows Store apps.
trans-unit.target: For these apps, you can also ignore the Package security identifier (SID), which is only available for Windows Store apps.

trans-unit.source: For a non-Windows Store app, navigate to the My Applications page in the Microsoft account Developer Center, log on with your Microsoft account (if required), click **Create application**, then type an **Application name** and click **I accept**.
trans-unit.target: For a non-Windows Store app, navigate to the My Applications page in the Microsoft account Developer Center, log on with your Microsoft account (if required), click **Create application**, then type an **Application name** and click **I accept**.

trans-unit.source: This reserves you app name with Microsoft account and displays the Microsoft account page for your app.
trans-unit.target: This reserves you app name with Microsoft account and displays the Microsoft account page for your app.

trans-unit.source: In the Microsoft account page for your app, click **API Settings**, select enable **Mobile or desktop client app**, set the mobile service URL as the **Target domain**, supply a value of `https://<mobile_service>.azure-mobile.net/` in **Redirect URL**, then click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: In the Microsoft account page for your app, click **API Settings**, select enable **Mobile or desktop client app**, set the mobile service URL as the **Target domain**, supply a value of `https://<mobile_service>.azure-mobile.net/` in **Redirect URL**, then click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]For a .NET backend mobile service published to Azure by using Visual Studio, the redirect URL is the URL of your mobile service appended with the path _signin-microsoft_ your mobile service as a .NET service, such as `https://todolist.azure-mobile.net/signin-microsoft`.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]For a .NET backend mobile service published to Azure by using Visual Studio, the redirect URL is the URL of your mobile service appended with the path _signin-microsoft_ your mobile service as a .NET service, such as `https://todolist.azure-mobile.net/signin-microsoft`.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft account API settings
trans-unit.target: Microsoft account API settings

trans-unit.source: The **Root domain** should be filled-in automatically.
trans-unit.target: The **Root domain** should be filled-in automatically.

trans-unit.source: Click **App Settings** and make a note of the values of the **Client ID**, **Client secret** and **Package SID**.
trans-unit.target: Click **App Settings** and make a note of the values of the **Client ID**, **Client secret** and **Package SID**.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft account app settings
trans-unit.target: Microsoft account app settings

trans-unit.source: In the [Azure Management Portal], click the **Identity** tab for the mobile service, enter the client ID, client secret and package SID obtained from your identity provider, and click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Azure Management Portal], click the **Identity** tab for the mobile service, enter the client ID, client secret and package SID obtained from your identity provider, and click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: Mobile Services Identity tab
trans-unit.target: Mobile Services Identity tab

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]You do not need to supply a Package SID value for a Windows Phone 8, Windows Phone Store 8.1 Silverlight, or a non-Windows app.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]You do not need to supply a Package SID value for a Windows Phone 8, Windows Phone Store 8.1 Silverlight, or a non-Windows app.

trans-unit.source: Both your mobile service and your app are now configured to work with Microsoft account.
trans-unit.target: Both your mobile service and your app are now configured to work with Microsoft account.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
